result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Edward Force was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Aggravated Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6).
  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Eric J. Lundell September 13, 2017

-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
-Credit to be determined.


-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution to be determined within 30 days, withheld from prison wages.

$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF85.
$250.00 DNA sample to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF85.
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any recommendations.

-NO CONTACT whatsoever with H.D.D. or extended family (including parents, grandparents  or siblings).
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
AODA Evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

***AMENDED***
Per Judge Eric J. Lundell May 3, 2017 -  Only take from prison wages and not gifted money.

-Consecutive to Count 1.
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to: Count 1

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Rohan, ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Benjamin Edward Force appeared from jail. Case called at 3:03 pm. PSI has been reviewed, no changes. ADA Nieskes provides sentence recommendations. Victim statements. Atty. Andrea makes statement. DF makes statement. Atty. Andrea files Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief. Court Orders:

Count 1
-3 years IC, 3 years ES with conditions

Count 2 - consecutive to Count 1
--3 years IC, 3 years ES with conditions

Count 3 - consecutive to Count 1
-3 years IC, 3 years ES with conditions

Conditions concurrent to each Count:
-N/C with H.D.D. or extended family (including parents, grandparents and siblings)
-AODA evaluation, follow through
-Psychological evaluation, follow through
-DNA sample and Surcharge $250
-Court costs for each count
-Restitution: amount to be determined within 30 days, withheld from amounts earned in prison
-Absolute sobriety: Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Credit to be determined
Right to appeal

Review at 08-24-2015 07:55 am

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Eric Gordon Johnson, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF:  Benjamin Edward Force appeared from jail.  Court called at 10:00 a.m. Attorney Andrea advises there is an agreement.  Attorney Andrea recites the agreement.  Victim rights have been complied with.  State has filed an amended Information with the Court. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to amended Ct 1 (Strangulation and Suffocation).  Court enters a Guilty plea.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1.  DE pleads No Contest to amended Ct 2 (Aggravated Battery).  Court enters a No Contest plea.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2.  DE pleads Guilty to amended Ct. 3 (False Imprisonment).  Court enters a Guilty plea.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 3.   Crt orders a PSI and once the PSI is reviewed the SEH will then be scheduled.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 10:20 a.m. lw  Review scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 07:55 am.

15SW46 executed on 03-05-2015. gme
Preliminary hearing on March 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.

***AMENDED***

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, H.D.D. dob 10/28/1995 or S. B. or the residence (225 Church Street River Falls, WI).  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Jennifer Anne Bork,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Benjamin Edward Force appeared from jail.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.   Prelim demanded. Request speedy prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA Matthew Hartung, Atty Alex Andrea and Benjamin Force appears from jail. Defendant is on a PO hold. ADA Hartung is requesting Defendant be held without bail. Court orders $100.000.00 CB and sets for Initial 3/3/15 @ 1:00 p.m.
